Description: Ovoid wheelmade jar with bead rolled rim, short narrow neck and wide shoulder tapering to a narrow rounded base. Damaged base. Scrape marks visible on exterior, as well as a roughly incised pot mark that perhaps represents a fish.
Cultures/periods: Nubia and Sudan periods and cultures
Curator's comments: Cf. W. M. F. Petrie, ‘Ceremonial Slate Palettes and Corpus of Protodynastic Pottery’ (London, 1953), 8 I f-h. Bibliography: F. Ll. Griffith, 'Liverpool Annals of Archaeology and Anthropology 8 (Liverpool, 1921), 13.
